column3: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
No one who achieves success does so without acknowledging the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
Feeling gratitude isn't born in us - it's something we are taught, and in turn, we teach our children.

Thank you, dear God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough. Thank you for the rain. And for the chance to wake up in three hours and go fishing: I thank you for that now, because I won't feel so thankful then.
Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude. Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts.
Gratitude bestows reverence, allowing us to encounter everyday epiphanies, those transcendent moments of awe that change forever how we experience life and the world.
Thanks to television, for the first time the young are seeing history made before it is censored by their elders.
I work very hard, and I play very hard. I'm grateful for life. And I live it - I believe life loves the liver of it. I live it.
Joy is the simplest form of gratitude.
Such lovely warmth of thought and delicacy of colour are beyond all praise, and equally beyond all thanks!
The trick is to be grateful when your mood is high and graceful when it is low.
When you are grateful - when you can see what you have - you unlock blessings to flow in your life.
I'm thankful for serendipitous moments in my life, where things could've gone the other way.
I'm grateful for my brokenness. I'm grateful for my humility.

As we look forward to freedom, the shining city on the hill and the best days of America lying ahead, it is the men and women in uniform who protect, defend and make us proud to whom we should look and give thanks every night.
I'm grateful for always this moment, the now, no matter what form it takes.
Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
The thankful receiver bears a plentiful harvest.
For what I have received may the Lord make me truly thankful. And more truly for what I have not received.
Be thankful we're not getting all the government we're paying for.
I'm really thankful and complimented when people come to me and say, thank you for the great times for all these years. But I don't think about it as being a leader.

I had the pleasure, as Robin said, to live a childhood dream as many young Americans and Puerto Rican children live that play youth baseball. And I feel honored and very thankful for that opportunity.
I have spent over 60 years bent over a guitar and to know that I wrote 70 compositions that masters have recorded, that makes me feel so good and full, and proud and thankful to the good Lord.
As a child, I didn't know what I didn't have. I'm thankful for the challenges early on in my life because now I have a perspective on the world and kind of know what's important.
I'm thankful for the three ounce Ziploc bag, so that I have somewhere to put my savings.

Every musician, their goal in life is to play music that people love, and I've accomplished my goal. I was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and left that chapter of my life and those people in the past. Good and bad, I've loved and am thankful for that chapter.
